history.text: Hello How are you today?
Great! How are you? So what do you think of Bruce Almighty?
I am good. I loved the movie. Jim Carrrey and Morgan Freeman together in 1 movie is amazing
Very true! I agree with CinemaScore's rating of A as that's the rating I would give it! So who was your favorite character in the film?
Morgan Freeman when he played GOD. His wit and such was just a prefect role for him to play in.
I dont really agree with the Rotten Tomatoes score of 48%. Its considered one of Jim Carreys best movies.
Agreed! I loved Freeman as God as well as Carrey as Bruce Nolan! I feel this was one of Carey's best films!
Agreed about Rotten Tomatoes. I lean more toward CinemaScore's rating! 48% is wrong in my opinion +
I agree. I think this movie was when comedy was based on funny and not so much as crude as it is today.
So true! Carrey was so hilarious especially in the slapstick scenes!
What did think of the leading ladies?
I think Jennifer Aniston plays the best girl friend. Its her querk thats makes her the best.
I was really fond of Jennifer Aniston' s portrayal of Grace Connelly as his girlfriend but also liked his secret crush played by Catherine Bell who barely seemed to notice him as well!
Very true! How did you like Steve Carroll's character Evan?
Evan Baxter was the  perfect protrayal  of the coworker we all love to hate.
So true! That was very wrong of him to steal dialogue from one of Bruce's unaired segments. But as you said, he was the perfect portrayal of the coworker we all love to hate!
It was very wrong indeed but Evan got his just desserts in the end.
True! So what did you think of Bruce's ability to to cause miraculous events?
Almost everyone knows how it feel Bruce was passed over for a promotion.
It makes one think what would happen if we could always get what we wanted

So true. It's very relatable! We all have those down on our luck moments and would love to be God for a week! Of course, I'm not sure if I could go as far as using those powers to humiliate Evan on air, causing him to get fired! Ha!
I think him finding Jimmy Hoffa's body was hilarious.
Same here! Plus it earned him his job back which was a plus!
I get the feeling that this moving had alone of religious undertones, not counting GOD. But alot praying for what you want and you shall receive it.
Agreed. Plus Bruce's unselfish act of praying for Grace to find a better man, ultimately reconciling with Bruce. I enjoyed that scene as well.

But it makes one realize to enjoy the simple things like and not expect to get everything you every wanted. Like Bruce did after hisrecovery from being hits by a vehicle. He learned to take pleasure in simple things.
That is true. And it ultimately led to he and Gracie getting engaged  - announcing it on live television at that!
"And that is How the Cookie Crumbles"  I liked the ending. it really made it pull all together
I did as well... the homeless man revealing himself to be god was the perfect ending!
Yes it did. Have a great day. It was very nice chatting with you.
Likewise! Have a great day as well! I enjoyed chatting with you about the 2003 comedy Bruce Almighty! Take care!

uid2response.feedback: Everything went great! I enjoyed it!
